alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 8:46PM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds could gust Winds could gust between 40 to 50 mph. Visibility reduced to one-half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong North Pacific low is poised to move across the Eastern Aleutian Chain and into the southern Bering Sea Tuesday evening into Wednesday. The front will make it to the Kuskokwim Delta Coast Tuesday night. East-northeast winds pick up during the afternoon Tuesday and peak late Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. Precipitation is expected to start Tuesday evening and begin to taper off Wednesday morning. The strongest winds and lowest visibilities with falling snow are expected to be late Tuesday night into early Wednesday morning before conditions slowly improve later Wednesday morning as the front continues moving northward
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
